data.title: Macrolife [signed] by Zebrowski, George: First Edition.
data.meta_description: First Edition. - Harper and Row, New York; (1979) - Octavo. Signed by the author, and additionally inscribed by author Jack Dann to his mother, and with a laid in proof wrapper for the paperback edition. 284(1) pp., The book opens in the year 202`1. Inspired by the possibilities of space settlements, projections of biology and cosmology, and basic human longings, Macrolife is a visionary speculation of the long term future of human and natural history. Filled with haunting images and memorable characters, this is a vivid and brilliant work. Bound in 1/4 dark blue cloth over orange paper covered boards stamped in blind, spine lettering silver. a very nice, sharp cornered copy in unclipped pictorial dust jacket lettered in yellow and white. Near fine. - Macrolife [signed]
data.text:
About this Item

Octavo. Signed by the author, and additionally inscribed by author Jack Dann to his mother, and with a laid in proof wrapper for the paperback edition. 284(1) pp., The book opens in the year 202`1. Inspired by the possibilities of space settlements, projections of biology and cosmology, and basic human longings, Macrolife is a visionary speculation of the long term future of human and natural history. Filled with haunting images and memorable characters, this is a vivid and brilliant work. Bound in 1/4 dark blue cloth over orange paper covered boards stamped in blind, spine lettering silver. a very nice, sharp cornered copy in unclipped pictorial dust jacket lettered in yellow and white. Near fine. Seller Inventory # 022673

Contact seller
